intro: Dracocephalum virginianum, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive minty aroma. Dracocephalum virginianum is often found in dry, open habitats such as fields and woodland edges.
